headline: Public Affairs Officer at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement's National IPR Center

positions.description:
- Develops media plans, media strategies and media events for assigned accounts in support of overall Army objectives.

- Provides advice to the Chief of Public Affairs, Deputy Chief of Public Affairs and Program Specialists in the Army Staff on the public information policy implications of regional, national and international Army programs.

- Furnishes advice, assistance and direction to major Army commands and Army Public Affairs personnel worldwide on the planning and execution of information campaigns within assigned account areas.

- Responds to national and international media queries related to acquisition, contracting, Ground Combat Vehicle, Joint Light Tactical Vehicle, Stryker, Abrams, Soldier equipment, budget, missile defense and several other account portfolios.
positions.title: Media Relations Officer

positions.description:
- Wrote over 30 articles featured on Army.mil, which provided positive internal exposure to Army initiatives such as the Lakota acquisition, eCybermission and educational outreach.

- Wrote and issued numerous press releases concerning high-level command events, including promotions, change of commands and community outreach programs.

- Successfully launched Aberdeen Proving Ground's social media efforts, including Facebook, Twitter and Flickr, resulting in enhanced customer information and command ability to react to and solve garrison concerns.

- Provided expert photo support and layout design services for website and installation newspaper during post-wide events and command outreach.

- As the public affairs action officer, provided support at high-level Army events, including the 2010 U.S. Army All-American Bowl and the Chemical Stockpile Emergency Preparedness Program.

- Participated in a professional development opportunity with Defense Media Activity and Army News Service, and successfully covered high-level events and issues including the president's 9/11 Pentagon speech, the anniversary of Operation Dragoon, and the historical contributions of women in the military.
positions.title: Public Affairs Specialist (RDECOM)

positions.description:
- Managed the ordering supply process, performed key aspects of account payable process, and helped coordinate the employee pay process for an office of over 100 people.

- Coordinated with the marketing division, design teams and outside vendors to produce pamphlets, workbooks, business cards, signage and other branded material.

- Involved in the request for proposal process, including the formation and delivery of proposals, which resulted in winning bids with AARP, PBS and American Diabetes Association.

- Performed key executive officer responsibilities for corporate leaders, including developing their itineraries as well as airline reservations and lodging plans during business travel.

- Recognized and named Employee of the Quarter during the second quarter of 2009 for key contributions to the Design and User Experience and Marketing teams.
positions.title: Office Manager

positions.description: - Performed key research on Economic Departments at public and private universities enabling charitable decisions, and resulting in key contributions to Florida State University and George Mason University.
positions.title: Intern

positions.description:
- Wrote dozens of columns for Accuracy in Academiaâs Campus Report Online, providing accurate and relevant coverage on education issues including No Child Left Behind legislation and Creationism in the classroom.

- Featured on National Review Online, via Candace de Russy's (Hudson Institute) blog, resulting in expanded reach and coverage in support of education reform.

- Reported on conferences and debates held at think-tanks in the DC/Metro Area, resulting in comprehensive and cogent articles on issues ranging from evolution to education reform.
positions.title: Intern
